message_1:
Suppose we have the following two statements:

P: All mammals are warm-blooded.
Q: All whales are mammals.

Using relevance logic, determine whether the following conclusion is valid based on these premises:

R: Therefore, all whales are warm-blooded.

Is the conclusion R valid?
message_2:
Yes, the conclusion R is valid. 

Using the given statements P and Q, we can deduce the conclusion R through a logical argument. Since all whales are mammals (Q) and all mammals are warm-blooded (P), it follows that all whales must also be warm-blooded. Thus, the conclusion R is valid based on the premises P and Q.
